thread.title: Scott Walker says he'll sign bill banning 'John Doe' probes
thread.title_full: Scott Walker says he'll sign bill banning 'John Doe' probes

title: Scott Walker says he'll sign bill banning 'John Doe' probes
text:
Scott Walker says he'll sign bill banning 'John Doe' probes Walker was investigated by two probes, but never charged Published On: Oct 22 2015 05:24:48 PM CDT Updated On: Oct 23 2015 06:21:08 AM CDT Tweet MILWAUKEE - 
Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker says he'll sign legislation banning so-called John Doe investigations into potential political corruption, a measure that passed the Legislature this week. Related Content Assembly passes campaign finance overhaul bill 
Speaking at a groundbreaking in Milwaukee Thursday afternoon, the Republican governor said he looks forward to approving the bill. He says it's just a matter of how quickly it gets to his desk, whether that's "in the next day or two or early next week." 
Republicans have been united in their support for the plan. They say prosecutors can use other tools, such as grand juries, to uncover political wrongdoing. 
Democrats, meanwhile, voted together in opposition, saying a block on the secretive fact-finding probes would lead to more undetected corruption. 
Walker was investigated by two John Doe probes but was never charged. 
Copyright 2015 The
